page.title: 02Eling Village & Eling Mill
page.content:
{Rural}: From the Tollbridge along Eling Hill Road has a distinctly rural setting. St. Mary's Church dominates the hill, 300 year cottages, a Rectory now private dwellings, a non_working farm _ ELING HILL FARM, a DAIRY FARM _ Cole's, a few modern bungalows and 2 public houses, The Village Bells and King Rufus.
{Residential}: mostly private dwellings, dates the 1880s, 1913 and the 1930s, these being of terrace, semi and detatched type. Small shops and an 1890s Board School.
{Industrial}: Timber yards, Whare houses centered around the Wharf area.light industry includes metal craft and welding. The Eling Tide Mill now restored is a tourist attraction and producer of stone ground flour.
